summary: Email chain between UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) officials and US Department of Justice (SDNY) prosecutors regarding coordination on an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's relationship with JP Morgan's private wealth division. The FCA seeks to determine who is handling the Epstein investigation and requests an urgent call to discuss the matter.

persons.name: Mark Steward
persons.role: Executive Director of Enforcement and Market Oversight at the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)
persons.context: Initiates contact with US prosecutors to inquire about the Epstein investigation, specifically regarding JP Morgan, and coordinates a call.

persons.name: Kate Tuckley
persons.context: CC'd on emails, assists in coordinating the urgent call between FCA and US prosecutors.

persons.name: Harry Caldecott
persons.role: Private Secretary to Mark Steward at the FCA
persons.context: Listed as private secretary in email signatures, CC'd on correspondence.

persons.name: Kelly Eldred
persons.role: Personal Assistant to Mark Steward at the FCA
persons.context: Listed as personal assistant in email signatures, CC'd on correspondence.

persons.name: Jason Cowley
persons.context: CC'd on emails from the US side, part of the SDNY team involved in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.role: Client of JP Morgan private wealth division, subject of investigation
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the investigation, specifically his relationship with JP Morgan.

connections.description: Steward reaches out to Cowley's office to coordinate on the Epstein investigation, indicating a cross-border regulatory/law enforcement connection.
Steward, as an FCA enforcement director, is inquiring about investigations into Epstein's financial activities.
Caldecott is identified as Steward's private secretary, providing administrative support.
Eldred is identified as Steward's personal assistant, providing administrative support.

events.title: FCA inquiry about Epstein investigation
events.description: Mark Steward of the UK FCA sends an urgent email to US prosecutors inquiring about who is handling the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, specifically regarding JP Morgan.

events.title: Coordination call scheduled
events.description: After initial contact, FCA and SDNY officials schedule a call for later that day (4:15 PM UK time) to discuss the Epstein matter.

events.title: Follow-up on voluminous material
events.description: Mark Steward indicates the FCA has received additional voluminous material related to the case, delaying meaningful conversation until possibly Friday.

locations: 12 Endeavour Square, London E20 1JN, United Kingdom (FCA headquarters)
New York, USA (implied location of SDNY)
keyFacts: The UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) was actively seeking information about the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in late November 2019.
The FCA's inquiry specifically mentioned Epstein's relationship with JP Morgan's private wealth division, indicating a financial regulatory angle to the investigation.
The communication shows coordination between UK financial regulators and US federal prosecutors (SDNY) regarding the Epstein case.
The emails are marked "Confidential & Urgent," highlighting the sensitivity and priority of the matter.
The document reveals that by December 2019, the FCA had received "voluminous" additional material related to the Epstein investigation.
